title: T207 mid-grade starter set for sale - nice group!
author: frohme

posts.post_title: T207 mid-grade starter set for sale - nice group!
posts.post_content:
Not something you see every day - very decent lot of 88 different graded  T207's.   Want to move these cards as a lot - they'll be going to an auction house if there's no interest, or the swarm of T206 posts knock it off the front page.

[URL="http://imageevent.com/gspinf/forsaletrade/t207starterset"]Card images are here[/URL]. Also have available a [URL="http://photos.imageevent.com/gspinf/forsaletrade/t207starterset/StarterSet.xls"]spreadsheet with all cards[/URL].  Average grade of these cards is just a shade under SGC 45 - there are very few slouches in the lot.  You'll see these come up at the auction houses from time to time, but rarely in this  overall condition.  If you know T207's, I think this lot speaks for itself.

Included are some tough cards:

15 Broadleaf class cards, including:


  * Donnelly - SGC 35
  * Kutina - SGC 50 (Louisiana Find)
  * Miller (Otto) - SGC 40
  * Moore - SGC 40
  * Sweeney - SGC 30
  * Tyler - SGC 20
  * Wilson (Pitt) - PSA3 (MK)
  * ...


Various difficult Recruit class cards - either scarcity or grade/scarcity


  * Barry- SGC 60
  * Block - SGC 30
  * Carrigan - SGC 30
  * Fromme - SGC 50 (very tough in this grade)
  * Higgins - PSA 2.5
  * Livingston "A" - SGC 30
  * R. Morgan - SGC 35
  * Perdue - SGC 40
  * Schardt - SGC 40
  * Schulte - PSA 5
  * Scott - SGC A
  * Stovall - SGC 40
  * Sullivan - SGC 30
  * ...


Grade breakdown:

  * SGC 60 - 11
  * SGC 50 - 18
  * SGC 45 - 1
  * SGC 40 - 19
  * SGC 35 - 2
  * SGC 30 - 8
  * SGC 20 - 3
  * SGC A - 2


  * PSA 6 - 2 (1 MC)
  * PSA 5 - 6 (1 MC)
  * PSA 4 - 6
  * PSA 3.5 - 1
  * PSA 3 - 3 (1 MK)
  * PSA 2.5 - 1
  * PSA 2 - 1
  * PSA 1.5 - 1
  * PSA 1 - 3


Asking $9500.  PM, email if interested - thanks for looking.

--
Mike
Wow!!!!  Terrific lot, Mike!  Best of luck selling them, buddy!
Awesome lot at a very fair price.  Quite a few super tough cards in there.  Good luck with your sale!
Great selection of toughies!  Good luck Mike.

What a great "starter" lot Mike! This is a very solid listing, even for more advanced T207 collectors. Best of luck!

Tom
Nice group, Mike.  Thought you deserved a bump...

Thanks Ron, Tom, John, Jimi, and Marc,

Appreciate the feedback and best wishes.  Sadly, though, selling T207's on the BST is fruitless.  I suspect offering the entire set for that price would draw few responses beyond yourselves and a few notable others.

Cards available as lot till 5/7/2013.
--
Mike

Mike,    Thats a great group of cards.    Send them to  one of the good auction houses.  T207's don't get any respect,  but someday,  when the T206 craze slows down,  they may have their day.  Many are truly scarce cards.  Time will tell.

Thanks, Bill,

They were headed that way for an upcoming auction but I found that I had left some in a SD box that was going to take a while to get to.  

Long story short, that's still the plan, following this BST offer, it'll just be a month or so later than intended... anyone wanting individual cards will certainly have the option then.

Hope you're well - still picking up any 207's?
--
Mike

Mike,

I would gladly go after this group, if my finances were just a little more solid at the moment.

I am interested in some others you have listed on your selling pages. 

Tom
